basics.name: Bruno Finger
basics.label: Senior Web Developer
basics.summary: Open-minded, 29 years old, currently living in Poland. In his spare time, he spends time with his family and daughters, learns music theory & production (and tries to make some cool sounding music), develops personal projects, plays games. Seeks an environment that is non-bureaucratic and uncomplicated, relaxed and modern in their ways of thinking, which enables fast-paced personal and professional growth and at the same time is challenging enough to learn. Wants to be valued and provide a good life for his family.

work.summary: US-based, the 17hats platform provides their clients with full-featured Lead Management, Booking Coordination, Customer Onboarding, Workday and Workflow, and Financials systems in one place.
highlights: Developed complex functionalities in React and KnockoutJS
Helped with the development of a standard custom UI framework in React
Migrated parts of the system from React to KnockoutJS
Developed a Zapier integration for the platform written in TypeScript, currently in beta phase

work.summary: Coresystems AG is a software developing company, headquartered in Switzerland, and a provider of field service management solutions for technicians.
highlights: Worked applying bug fixes and developing new features for a Workforce Management software used by clients with more than 10 thousand technicians on the field every day
Took part in the two-months long “Operation HardCore” writing missing tests for key components of the applications and modernizing the project structure

Was responsible for one of the main applications called “Configuration”, key responsibilities include deciding the best time to deploy the application directly to all the live clusters used by customers every day in the US, EU and DE (Germany has its own dedicated cluster) based on traffic logs, error logs and other information powered by Kibana and other powerful tools, and make the actual deployment through Bamboo

work.summary: Seventh is a Brazilian company that develops technology for video surveillance (Seventh D-Guard). Founded in 2001, the company has been a pioneer in development of wide range of technologies for reception, transmission and storage of video streams trough the internet.
highlights: Seventh D-Guard Web: a modernized web front-end for a video surveillance application: Started this project from scratch. Was responsible for managing and making decisions about this project. The development and management were given remotely. The goal of the project is the replacement of a desktop interface in Delphi by a modern web interface. This application allows full control of a security cameras monitoring system, including live video, motion detection settings, and compensation of distortion of fish-eye cameras. It involves the integration of a REST API with a system developed in AngularJS using Angular Material user interface

Seventh Situator: The Situator is a Physical Security Information Management system (PSIM), a web application for handling video events generated by D-Guard (the video surveillance application from the same company). Was part of the team developing the web front-end for the C# backend before assuming responsibility for the D-Guard Web project

Seventh Projects Calculator: The Seventh Projects Calculator was developed especially for use in projects that use the D-Guard projects system. Their use is essential to help estimate the servers, the bandwidth, the amount of storage and the necessary licenses for your video project monitoring

work.summary: Digitro Tecnologia Ltda. was founded in 1975. The Company's line of business includes the manufacturing of radio and television broadcasting and communications equipment
highlights: Was part of the core team responsible for developing a communication audit and log software used by the Brazilian courts

work.summary: Worked co-managing the CREMESC's (Council of Medicine of the State of Santa Catarina) and CREFITO's (Regional Council of Physiotherapy) databases and organizing the associates' personal data into the system, as well as developing small to medium port Java desktop and Web systems for both organizations, varying from a postal labelling system to a subscription payment page. Worked remotely from Poland for 3 months.

education.institution: Universidade do Sul de Santa Catarina (UNISUL)
Central Ostrobothnia University of Applied Sciences (CENTRIA)

courses: Music Theory for Electronic Music Production, 2019
ES6 Javascript: The Complete Developer's Guide, 2017
Academy of Java 128 hours OCJP/SCJP course, 2009

publications.name: Cardápio Digital para Tablets: Gerenciando Pedidos com a Plataforma Android
publications.publisher: Universidade do Sul de Santa Catarina
publications.summary: Computer Science final thesis publication. Graded 9.8 out of 10.
